WorkItem.Description:
The WPF Toolkit Calendar control may have a bug in its HeaderButtonTemplate. It appears that the default control template tries to set a TextColor property on a layout grid, rather than a text control within the grid. VS 2008 (with Silverlight 3.0 Tools installed) throws the following exception:
 
    'TextColor' name cannot be found in the name scope of 'System.Windows.Controls.Grid'.
 
The debugger highlights the following markup inside the HeaderButtonTemplate control template:
 
<Storyboard>
    <ColorAnimation Duration="00:00:00" Storyboard.TargetName="TextColor" Storyboard.TargetProperty="Color" To="#FF73A9D8"/>
</Storyboard>
 
I have attached a XAML file with the full calendar template. The exception is thrown at line 78 in the file
